title: How does an orchestra decide which pieces to play on a given night? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Music Director makes those decisions well in advance. Rep for entire season is laid out during the season prior, and announced in the second half of that prior season (so they can get everyone excited and sell more subscriptions!). Considerations for concert choices will include what the orchestra's played in the past few seasons, what pieces the audience buys tickets for, which soloists are available when, which conductors are available when, how many concerts will be pops, are we doing a movie this year, and probably lots of other things that the President and board want the MD to consider to sell tickets and attract sponsors.
